Package edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course

Class Activity

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course.Activity
All Implemented Interfaces:
Conflict
Direct Known Subclasses:
Course
public abstract class Activity extends Object implements Conflict
This is the abstract class which is the super class for Course and Event. It has the getter and setter methods and handles the common checks between Event and Course for setMeetingDays. The isDuplicate method is overridden for Event and Course which is why it is blank. The checkConflict method is also overridden to properly implement its functionality for event and course classes.
Author:
Arnav Ganguly

    • setMeetingDaysAndTime

      public void setMeetingDaysAndTime(String meetingDays, int startTime, int endTime)
      Combined set meetingDays, startTime and endTime into one method to simplify code. Makes sure that the mentioned meetingDays, startTime and endTime for the course are valid and follow the requirements
      Parameters:
      meetingDays - is the details for the meeting days
      startTime - is the time the class starts
      endTime - is the time the class ends
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if meetinddays is null/empty Or if the start and end times are invalid (start time after end time, or less than 0)

    • getMeetingString

      public String getMeetingString()
      This is a getter method for the details of the Course classes in a readable format
      Returns:
      a String with meetingDays, start and end time given.

    • isDuplicate

      public abstract boolean isDuplicate(Activity activity)
      This method is overridden for Event and Course which is why its blank.
      Parameters:
      activity - is the activity object
      Returns:
      true or false based of what kind of object is entered as a parameter and this method is written differently in Event and Course

    • checkConflict

      public void checkConflict(Activity possibleConflictingActivity) throws ConflictException
      This is the method that checks conflict between two activities. The checks are the same for events and courses so its implemented in activity
      Specified by:
      checkConflict in interface Conflict
      Parameters:
      possibleConflictingActivity - is the activity we use to compare and check for a conflict
      Throws:
      ConflictException - if the activities are conflicting
